bioghist.p: Hazel Shaw (1897-1993) attended Chicago Teacher's College, 1920-1921. She taught in private and settlement schools before going to Punjab, India for missionary service in 1927. In India, Shaw worked at the Moga Training School, the Kolhapur Church Council School, the Ewing Christian School in Ludhiana, and doing community work in Ambala. During the summers, Mrs. Shaw taught kindergarten at Woodstock School. Her husband, Harry Evans Shaw (1901-1981) was the joint principal of the Ruth Memorial Health Center.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of photographs taken while the Shaws were in India. Photographs include village scenes, schools and students; an open air clinic; staff of the mission; members of the Punjab Synod, circa 1955; Rev. R. T. Meeker preaching in a village; members of the India Council, 1951; and staff of the Ruth Memorial Health Center, 1934.
